title: Why aren't we nerfing Riven, Vayne, Zed.
body:
Nothing personal but... Plat+ Global 
Champion....Winrate....Pickrate...Banrate
{{champion:67}} 52.9....28.1....28.7
{{champion:238}} 53.0....13.8....50.1
{{champion:92}} 53.3....15.5....20.0

Jinx, Ahri, Soraka, Nami, J4 are pretty honorable mentions too. 
Why do we allow such high pickrate champions to also enjoy high winrate? Whatever happened to the balance team that we got on this whole winrate and pickrate mean nothing balance strategy. 

Also thought I'd mention its also not because you can just learn how to play against them. If Morde was high winrate I might be like Learn to kite. Riven and zed just dash to you and kill you too quickly. 

I'd complain more about vayne but I don't see her. Its hard to complain about something you can't see.

Edit: link to data 
https://lolalytics.com/ranked/worldwide/platinum/plus/champions/

her kit is weak, her  combo that she has to burn all 3 spells to do is  400 + 100% AP and then lich bane unless she manages to space them in a fight; and that's if you're level 18 

what's powerful about her are her ultimate, and the reliability of her spells.  You can not miss any of her basic abilities and you can not miss her auto attack


let's do some math and say that she gets a lich bane proc on all 3 spells

4.5 seconds minimum (which would be impossible given the animation time)

base AD damage x 0.75 x 3 = 2.25AD ;  lich bane damage 50% AP x 3 = 150% AP

2.25 AD + 410(magic damage) + 150% AP lich bane

let's say she has 1000 AP with a full build

1500 + 410 = 1910 magic damage + 2.25 AD physical damage in an impossible 4.5 seconds

100 AD = 225

#2135 / 4.5 = 474 dps  interesting, this might be where some of her damage potential comes from, but that would mean that lich bane is a large part of the problem.  It also assumes that the opponent lets her get close enough to auto attack repeatedly for that time

you can factor in another part of her passive that makes her deal 40% extra damage with her passive, so let's throw that in there just to see

(240 + 20% AP) * 1.4 =  336 + 28% AP .  it added a chunk, but not much 96 and 8% ap to her overall combo

I suppose if we wanted to get technical, we could count that her Q splits in 2 to add 160 + 50% AP to a second target or that any ally that gets "tagged" by her aura can deal 30 + 30% AP on their auto attack once

this is getting very complicated

#here is a potential source of sona's power:  the Q aura.  30 + 30% AP doesn't seem like much, but this at level 16 is on a 4.8 second max cooldown, 2.65 second if max CDR.  A high level sona player would be better to ask about this

it's unlikely, but it adds up to potential damage of 120 + 120% AP for her allies to apply.  If this is a persistent effect and not once-only, it would quickly rack up damage

we might have stumbled onto something that riot could use to affect her "hidden" power

Those numbers are all nice and good and I understand where you are coming from... but these numbers are irrelevant on an enchanter. Her burst comes from passive combined with Q (and if you really wanna be one of those "supports" you can add lich bane to that too). Her kit is strong, she has damage/burst, she has heals, MS buffs, Debuffs and an AoE stun. What does she pay for all that? Durability --> Just like every other pure enchanter. Utility instead of durability. A weak kit wouldn't be played and would have a low winrate. Both can't be said about current Sona.

If you really want to deal damage and carry the game play Brand, Zyra, Lux, Velkoz botlane.
